Digital Specialist

Company Name IKEA Australia Company Location Sydney, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 7 hours ago Number of views 20 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

You see things a little differently. So do we. We believe that what you value is more important than what your CV says. We offer positions that will challenge your skills and let you grow. Come see things a little differently with us.


We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Digital Specialist to join our Web, Ecommerce & Digital team based at our Service Office in Tempe. The role reports into the Digital Optimisation Manager and is responsible for the end to end digital user experience and content management to convert more consumers into customers.


About you

As a savvy Digital Specialist with minimum of 2 years digital experience you understand the importance of putting the customer at the centre of the communication. Your outgoing personality and your passion to work with business stakeholders sets you apart. You like working in a changing environment and bring analytical decision making into everything you do. With an interest in home furnishing and people’s everyday life at home, our ideal candidate will have an understanding of user experience, content management and best practices in E-commerce retail. You will also have proven experience with Adobe Creative Suite, Content Management Systems, Google Analytics & a basic knowledge of HTML & CSS.

\xa0

About the job

Ecommerce is a new sales channel for IKEA in Australia with enormous potential. The online business is part of our global multichannel strategy and supports our ambition to become the world’s leading multichannel retailer. You will have the opportunity to support all digital channel visitors by offering the best browsing experience throughout the IKEA range. Contributing actively to attract and convert more consumers to customers and encourage existing customers to shop more frequently by using digital skills and home furnishing competence.

\xa0

About the assignment

In this assignment you will be responsible for but not limited to;

  • Contributing to site performance with a focus on driving conversion
  • Driving UX improvements across ikea.com.au with a focus on commerciality and user experience
  • Planning and keeping site product catalogues optimised and relevant to commercial priorities
  • Performance follow up of digital campaigns
  • Optimising the layout on the product listing pages, show width and depth of the IKEA range to support the seasonality and commercial priorities while simplifying the buying process
  • Following up the performance of the digital merchandising by measuring the engagement on the pages
  • Contributing to conversion optimisation by sharing recommendations with the sales leaders, for example for add-on sales and cross-selling.\xa0\xa0\xa0
\xa0\xa0\xa0

The IKEA Group is a world leader in the home furnishing business. We are a values-driven company with a passion for life at home. Our vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. The IKEA Group operates in 43 countries and our retail operations include 321 IKEA stores in 28 countries.

Media & Communications Adviser

Company Name NPS MedicineWise Company Location Sydney, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 12 hours ago Number of views 15 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Are you a strong communicator with great media and public relations experience?
  • Do you have an understanding of health and medical issues?
  • Full time, maximum term contract till 30 June 2021
Our mission

Independent, evidence-based and not-for-profit, we provide consumers and health professionals with practical tools and information about medicines, health conditions and medical tests. Our vision is to be an innovative change leader, trusted for our objective, collaborative and evidence-based approach to medicines and other medical choices.

http://www.nps.org.au

Who we’re looking for

We believe it's important to be excellent at what we do and to recognise the skills and experience we all bring. Our people are passionate about our mission and are invested in our values, so you should be too. We believe that cultural fit is essential to success. These are our values, and they influence how we work together and how we reward our people:
  • Courage - we have the courage to think and do things differently for a better future.
  • Customer centricity - we meet the needs of our customers by listening, responding to feedback and adding value.
  • Collaboration - we seek connections, share learnings and help each other succeed.
  • Integrity - we are ethical, honest, transparent and open-minded.
  • Accountability - we do what we say we will do.

What you’ll be doing

As our Media & Communications Adviser, you will be responsible for developing and driving our media, PR and corporate communications strategies, optimising message delivery through media outlets, promoting NPS MedicineWise and our work, and strengthening our positive reputation as an authority on medicines and medical tests issues.

You can confidently manage the diverse needs of multiple stakeholders, both internal and external, and have strong project management skills. To be successful in this role you will need a proactive approach in working with all parts of NPS MedicineWise to simplify complex messages to meet audience needs and finding ways to reach audiences with impact in a changing communications environment.

Having an existing network of media contacts is a plus!

What you will need
  • Proven high achiever in media relations, strategy and development with strong networks across Australian media
  • Exceptional communications and writing skills and demonstrated ability to simplify complex messages for diverse audiences
  • Experience in developing, implementing and evaluating innovative PR and communication strategies
  • Experience in writing and commissioning unique content for different channels and audiences
  • Experience in managing stakeholder relationships
  • Excellent project management and time management skills
  • Demonstrated team player with a strong and creative work ethic
  • A degree in professional communications or other relevant field and at least 6 years’ experience in a relevant role.



What we offer
  • Salary packaging
  • WorkLife Balance days (available after an initial qualifying period)
  • Extra leave during Christmas and New Year
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Training and Professional Development opportunities
  • Discounted health insurance
  • Annual flu vaccinations
  • Workplace banking program
  • Employee assistance program

Help make Australia more medicinewise.

For a full position description which outlines the specific role requirements and to see why NPS MedicineWise is such a great place to work, please visit:

http://www.nps.org.au/careers

We are committed to achieving a diverse workforce and we strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people for all our positions.

Contact: Stephanie Childs on (02) 8217 8733 for more information.

No agencies please.

You must be eligible to work in Australia. If you are successful for this role, you will be required to conduct pre-employment checks, including a Criminal History Check.

  • Hospital & Health Care
  • Health, Wellness and Fitness
  • Nonprofit Organization Management

Job Description

Duties

The Media and Communications Section is located within the Corporate and Research Division. The Section is responsible for managing the strategic external and internal communications for the Authority, and the Agency, to ensure the actions and decisions of the Authority are well understood and to further the positive positioning of the ACMA.

The role is responsible for managing the Section with a remit to:
  • provide strategic advice and planning in relation to external and internal communications;
  • oversee and prepare written, oral and digital communications materials including the development of graphic materials, publications, messaging, briefing materials, and questions and answers;
  • manage the dissemination of communications materials externally and internally;
  • manage issues relating to communications and engagement, including but not limited to stakeholder management, issue resolution, media management, editorial and branding services, and risk management as required;
  • assist Authority Members and staff to engage with relevant stakeholders including speech writing;
  • liaise with key stakeholders including those within government at the bureaucratic and Ministerial office level;
  • proactively manage the corporate communications strategic agenda including policies, plans, frameworks and protocols to support the successful delivery of this across all business line areas; and
  • aid in the implementation of the ACMA Corporate Plan through leading spotlight projects.
Eligibility

To be eligible for ongoing employment with the ACMA, applicants must be an Australian citizen.

An applicant's suitability for employment with the ACMA will be assessed through a pre-employment screening process. This process will include a requirement for the applicant to undertake and satisfy an AFP National Police check and to complete a Health Declaration.

This position requires a Baseline Vetting level security clearance. The successful applicant will be required to obtain and maintain a security clearance at this level.

About Australian Communications And Media Authority

ACMA is Australia’s regulator for broadcasting, the internet, radiocommunications and telecommunications.

We work with industry and government, locally and internationally, so that Australians can enjoy the best and most innovative media and communications services in a fair, responsible, safe and productive way.

The ACMA provides a supportive and respectful work environment that values the diversity of our employees. Our three main offices are in Canberra, Melbourne and Sydney. Visit acma.gov.au for more information on joining our team

Our client, a premier provider of systems, products and services in the defence, security and civil markets, is looking for an\xa0Electrical / Electronic Engineer with Australian citizenship and with ideally C4I/ICS PIT experience, to design and integrate electrical/electronic systems within vehicle platforms and to perform engineering investigations and design analysis within their Protected Vehicles division. Your key responsibilities will include:

  • Develop and / or integrate electrical and C4I systems, including an ICS (Integral Computing
  • System) for specialist medium-heavy vehicles including wiring and CAN bus architectures,
  • electrical/electronic component specification, analysis and verification

  • continuous improvement

.To be successful in this role, you will have/be:

  • Australian citizenship to be eligible for a Defence Security Clearance and must be ITARS cleared

  • guidance

  • Strong Organisation and time management skills
  • Experience in CAD - Mentor Graphics VeSys, & PTC Creo Cabling and Schematics
  • Knowledge of DOORS application tools
  • Occasional interstate and overseas travel may be required

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 10 views

Job description

MACPHERSON KELLEY

Macpherson Kelley is a hands-on commercial law firm, known for our business mindset, client service, innovation and investment in great relationships. With offices across Victoria, New South Wales and Queensland and a formal company structure, we offer you the opportunity to build your career in the real business world.

It is our goal for our clients, and our people, to be our strongest advocates.

OPPORTUNITY

An exciting and rare opportunity has arisen for an Office Services Assistant to join our newly refurbished Melbourne office. This busy role provides support to the Office Services Manager and on a range of office-based services including, but not limited to
  • Inventory stock takes and follow up on discrepancies
  • Relief for reception and concierge
  • Preparing induction kits,
  • Site inductions,
  • Office/work station set up & turnarounds,
  • Disposal of destruction bins,
  • Archiving retrievals & collections and associated admin and file management,
  • Meet, greet & liaise with technicians and contractors,
  • Lodgement of approved maintenance service calls ,
  • Titles support – banking and lodgements,
  • Distribution of mail and courier parcels within the office,
  • General tenancy tidiness
  • Support with ad hoc requests as they arise,

The office is friendly, bright and easy-going so it would be great if you have a similar nature and a, "can do" attitude.

ABOUT YOU

This role is ideally suited to someone who enjoys variety as you will be assisting with a broad range of work. This is an excellent foot in the door for anyone looking for a career in Office Services or facilities management and in order to be successful, you need to be pro-active, well organised and confident.

Ideally, we are looking for someone who has previous customer service or administrative experience. A knowledge of legal process is helpful, however not necessary. In order to be successful at Macpherson Kelley, you will naturally understand and share our values – talk straight, play as a team and be better each day. You will bring with you your excellent interpersonal skills and client service mentality.

THE EXTRAS

There are many benefits that we offer to support our flexible, innovative and positive work environment. There are purchase leave options as well as recognition incentives. Customer Insights Consultant

Company Name Coca-Cola Amatil Company Location Sydney

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 28 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Working at Coca-Cola Amatil is unlike any other career experience. We’re one of the largest beverage and food companies in the Asia-Pacific and partner of choice for some of the world’s leading brands. Our huge portfolio includes much-loved global and local brands such as Coca-Cola, Sprite, Kirks, Jim Beam, Canadian Club, Grinders, SPC and many more. What does this mean? Endless opportunity and a chance to be part of a team bursting with innovative thinkers and doers. These are people who are writing the next chapter of the Coca-Cola Amatil story, creating millions of moments of happiness and possibilities every day.

Do you enjoy consulting with customers and love working in a number-driven, rapidly changing business environment? Do you have passion for diving deep into data? Are you excited about leveraging data to demonstrate growth opportunities and sell in initiatives that generate value? Are you customer obsessed? If your answer is yes, we have the perfect opportunity for you within our Customer Business Intelligence team.

The Role

We have an excellent Customer Insights opportunity for a highly motivated and capable individual who wants to play a key role within our customer facing Business Intelligence Team. As a Customer Insights Consultant, you will be focused on delivering key insights that contribute to our business growth strategy, support our customers’ performance and further enhance Amatil’s reputation as the supplier of choice.

By utilising our customers’ very own transaction level data and sources such as Quantium, Nielsen and Aztec, identifying new information sources or by leveraging technology, you will be responsible for mining data and extracting our current data/knowledge to develop the next innovative growth solution for both Amatil and our customers. This is a hands-on role, which will require you to perform detailed analysis and translate key insights into strategies and recommendations for our Customers. This is a unique role that will call on your extensive analytical skills but also require you to demonstrate your 'blue sky' thinking by translating insights into strategic action for Amatil and our customers.

About You

We’re looking for someone who is passionate about data and has the technical skills to mine, analyse and derive actionable insights as well as having the ability to identify real world business opportunities that are commercially viable and contribute to driving growth for both the customer and Amatil.

Above all, your confident ability to present to managing directors and CEO’s within multiple customer groups as well as within Amatil, engaging them with our knowledge and understanding of their business will be key to your success. Your exceptional communication skills and ability to sell our ideas coupled with your ability to engage and influence senior management to implement significant initiatives or changes in their stores will be called on regularly in this position. Prior experience working with Nielsen, Aztec and Quantium consumer data will be highly regarded coupled with tertiary qualifications.

What you will require:

  • Extensive experience in leveraging large data sets and tools, preferably sales/ customer/ shopper/ loyalty data
  • Outstanding analytical capability, strong problem solving and critical thinking skills
  • Exceptional ability to break data down into a simple story
  • Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills
  • Great influencer and is able to quickly build rapport and credibility

This is an outstanding opportunity within a highly visible part of our business, dealing with a breadth of internal and external stakeholders and would suit a proactive, driven and passionate individual that enjoys providing insightful input into the future direction of our company.

Working at Amatil

At Amatil we value being straightforward and open, we take initiative and own the outcome and we focus on today and tomorrow. These values are the basis of how we do business and are the foundation of our culture.

We foster an environment where people are encouraged to innovate and contribute to the continuing success of our organisation. We are able to offer highly unique career opportunities to skilled and dedicated individuals who enhance and add value to our business, providing uncompromising commitment to customer satisfaction. Let’s write the next chapter of the Coca-Cola Amatil story together – apply today to create your own #onlyatamatil moment.

Applications Close Friday 26th October 2018.

Position: Marketing Coordinator

\xa0

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Leading Australian Fintech

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Make an Impact from Day 1

\xa0

About RateSetter

\xa0

RateSetter is pioneering peer-to-peer lending across the globe by connecting investors in search of better returns with creditworthy borrowers who want a simple, competitive personal loan. Growing at 100% YoY we’re scaling fast and that’s where you come in. We are looking for an energetic and driven marketing talent to join our team in a digital focused role as we go through a period of significant expansion.

\xa0

You will have experience in developing and implementing successful marketing campaigns for a fast-growing business or within an agency environment. You’ll work closely with the direct marketing lead to design, execute and measure marketing campaigns that help take our rapidly growing business up another gear.

\xa0

As a Marketing Coordinator you’ll assist in the end-to-end delivery of innovative marketing campaigns from strategy development through to execution to drive customer acquisition, engagement and retention.

We currently have a vacancy in our Brisbane Office for an enthusiastic Office Manager to join our global Finance Team. \xa0Working alongside our management and producers, you will take ownership of the administrative function of our Group of companies. \xa0The role includes , amongst other duties, managing the accounts payable function, actioning accounts receivables queries, debt collection, lodging business activity statements, accounting for payroll tax.


You’ll be supported by a great team of people, many of whom have been with the Group for a long time and bring a wealth of experience and assistance to your daily tasks. It’s important that you’re a self-starter, and someone that takes a very practical approach to your work. \xa0Having worked in a similar role for at least 5 years, your experience across all aspects of office administration will shine through on a daily basis.


In exchange for this we offer an inner-city workplace with on-site parking, a friendly team environment, and the opportunity to have a positive influence in a fast-growing international Group.



General Responsibilities


  • Calculate and lodge business activity statements

  • Calculate and report monthly superannuation liabilities

  • Calculate and report monthly payroll tax liabilities across all relevant States;

  • Fixed asset reconciliation management

  • Payroll journals where relevant

  • Assist with budgeting process on an annual and ad-hoc basis

  • Management of all AP invoices, including all data entry, verification, and payments

  • Management of company-issued credit cards including reconciliation of same

  • Review of all supplier accounts on a regular basis to ensure the Group is obtaining value for money

  • Implementation of software to improve the efficiencies of the position


Accounts Receivable

  • In conjunction with other Accounts staff, process accounts receivable invoices, credit notes and all queries, ensuring 100% accuracy in the completeness and timeliness of such tasks

  • Debt collection and resolution of any client queries

  • In conjunction with other Accounts staff members, daily cash-flow management and bank reconciliations


Skills Required


  • Min. 5 years experience in office management in medium to large group of companies, including offshore entities

  • Advanced Excel and Word skills

  • Exposure to GST, FBT, and payroll tax including calculation and lodgement of returns

  • Understanding of superannuation and reporting of same

  • Proven involvement in managing procurement processes and supplier relationships

  • Negotiation skills that facilitate mutually agreed outcomes between parties

  • A demonstrated display of initiative, common sense, proactivity, and practical thinking in the work-place


What you need to do now


At Cutting Edge, we value diversity and are passionate about placing people in a role where they can flourish and succeed. If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV.

911488315:
[

Senior Facilities Advisor

Company Name Parks Victoria Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 4 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At Parks Victoria, we love building healthy parks for healthy people and to ensure this we need our facilities to at their highest standards!
  • Newly created and ongoing position!
  • Be part of a team leading organisational change in asset and facility management.
  • Play an integral role to advise on good practice facility management in our parks.


About The Branch

The Asset Management branch is responsible for the provision of strategic management advice, support and direction to support divisional and regional delivery of asset management across the state. Parks Victoria manage a diverse portfolio with over 42,000 built assets. Parks Victoria is aspiring to achieve good practice in whole of life asset management in accordance with the Victoria Government's Asset Management Accountability Framework (AMAF). AMAF establishes criteria and requirements for managing assets consistently across all of Government.

About The Role And Your Responsibilities

As the Senior Facilities Advisor you'll provide specialist leadership in the assessment of Parks Victoria facilities, including our commercial properties, buildings and park facilities. This position is responsible for coordination of inspections, developing standardised frameworks and provision of strategic advice in respect to the overall works. Working with a maintenance program budget you will ensure facilities and assets are fit-for-purpose, compliant and operate to achieve financial and environmental sustainability. This includes audits on: building condition assessment and general maintenance (to develop life cycle assessments, capital improvement plans and maintenance plans), Essential Safety Measures (ESM), Building Code of Australia (BCA), Occupational Health and Safety (OH&S), Disability Access (DDA) and Hazardous Materials Assessment (HAZMAT).

This role will also be responsible for managing the tendering process, contractor management for inspections and service deliveries. There is a large focus on liaising with stakeholders to resolve complex issues across the organization and with other departments, and will ensure the timely delivery of these services, while providing a high level of customer service and support across the organization.

To Be Successful For This Role You Will Need
  • Significant experience in management of commercial buildings/properties in particular structural condition and compliance assessments.
  • Strong knowledge of the Building Code of Australia (BCA), Essential Service Measures (ESM), Occupational Health and Safety (OHS), Disability Discrimination Act (DDA), Hazardous Materials Assessment (HAZMAT)
  • Bachelor degree in a relevant field (including engineering, construction) or Diploma in Building & Construction Management or Facilities Management or equivalent.


Your Application Must Include
  • Your current Resume
  • A cover letter addressing the three below Key Selection Criteria (KSC) as outlined in the position description
  • Communicating with Influence
  • Asset Management
  • Commercial Skills and Knowledge

Join our innovative organisation and enjoy what you do, apply today!

Application Closing date: Thursday 25 October 2018

Parks Victoria requires all prospective employees to undergo a National Police Record Check prior to commencing employment.

At Parks Victoria, we recognise that diversity and inclusion are central to being a modern, high-performing sustainable organisation that can deliver our strategic vision to be a “world class parks service ensuring healthy parks for healthy people.”

Head Of Clinical Operations

Company Name Macquarie University Company Location University Avenue Macquarie University, Sydney, NSW 2109, AU

New Posted Date Posted 15 hours ago Number of views 17 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Novel and Innovative Research based at Macquarie University (North Ryde, Sydney)
  • Full-time, Fixed-term position for 3 years
  • Diverse role with the opportunity to contribute to the implementation of strategic plans for the unit

The Role

We are seeking a candidate to work with the Medical Director, Clinical Trials and Associate Dean, Research to develop and execute strategic plans for the sustainable growth of the clinical trials unit at Macquarie University.

The role will involve:

  • Providing professional client relationship management with clinical investigators, external and internal clients, including trial sponsors, and ensuring market presence of clinical research activities at MQ Health.
  • Identifying, assessing and recommending potential opportunities for the future growth of the unit.
  • Leading and developing a high performing team of clinical research professionals.
  • Developing and implementing a sustainable financial model for the unit.
  • Implementing a quality management system for the unit, ensuring compliance with ICH GCP and Australian and University regulations for the conduct of clinical trials.

About You

You will be commercially-focussed and have a thorough understanding of the clinical trials industry and standards. With a high level of drive and energy, you will be a key contributor to the future plans of the unit in alignment with the strategic goals of MQ Health.


You will be a strong people leader with an ability to oversee the development of a highly engaged existing team and recruit and train new team members as required. You will use your in-depth knowledge of clinical trials to ensure that quality management systems are implemented to be able to oversee the identification, analysis and management of risks associated with clinical trial projects.


About Us

The Macquarie University Clinical Trials Program at the Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences was set up in January 2013 to provide patients with opportunities to participate in the latest medical advances in cancer treatment. The Program has since continued to grow with research into a range of therapeutic areas drawing from the University’s research centres and works closely with industry sponsors to deliver timely access to cutting-edge therapies. The Clinical Trials Program is strategically placed within a unique academic health environment co-located on campus, which encompasses Macquarie University Hospital (Australia’s only university-owned and operated hospital), private outpatient clinics and the medical research undertaken within the Faculty.


Macquarie is a university engaged with the real and often complex problems and opportunities that define our lives. Since our foundation 54 years ago, we have aspired to be a different type of university. Over the years, we’ve grown to become the centre of a vibrant local and global community. Connect with us today.


To Apply

To be considered for this position, please apply online and attach your resume and a cover letter that outlines how you meet to the selection criteria below:

  • Degree or Master’s in life sciences or related discipline or equivalent combination of education and training in the conduct of clinical research with a strong business acumen.
  • An in-depth understanding of the clinical trials processes for phase I, II, III and IV clinical trials.
  • Highly developed and clearly demonstrated interpersonal and leadership skills.
  • Strong communication skills with an ability to negotiate with, and influence, a diverse group of stakeholders at all levels.
  • Ability to lead and deliver on projects involving risk management and process improvement in a clinical research setting.
  • Knowledge and understanding of clinical research governance models and regulatory frameworks.


For further information regarding this role, please visit the link below to view the position description;
http://jobs.mq.edu.au/cw/en/job/504550/head-of-clinical-operations


Role-Specific Enquiries: Professor Howard Gurney, Medical Director, Clinical Trials at howard.gurney@mq.edu.au


General Enquiries: Samantha Rego, HR Consultant at samantha.rego@mq.edu.au


Applications Close: Sunday, 28 October 2018 at 11:55pm (AEST)


Note: This position requires a criminal record check.


Macquarie University is committed to Equity, Diversity and Inclusion. We value individual difference and recognise the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where the backgrounds, perspectives and experiences of our staff are a driving force for collaboration, innovation and impact.


We work to ensure genuine equality of opportunity for people regardless of their gender, age, cultural background, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and/or family status, and we encourage you to apply for a position at Macquarie University. \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0

Business Transformation Leader

Company Name Virgin Australia Company Location Brisbane, AU

Job description

Our people are at the core of our business. We have the best talent doing the best work of their lives with meaning. We know their continuous focus on the guest experience is what sets us apart in our vision to be the world’s most rewarding travel experience.

Taking off is where the excitement lives. Join our team today.

Get To Know The Role

Our Business Transformation function supports the Virgin Australia business units through (you guessed it!) the process of transformation, in order to ensure each division is meeting their strategic outcomes.

Following an internal transfer, we now have a rare opportunity for a leader experienced in Business Transformation to join this team.

In this role, your day to day responsibilities will include:
  • Communicating and promoting your team's value proposition by forming and maintaining senior level relationships across the Senior Leadership Team;
  • Identifying, prioritising and maintaining a pipeline of opportunities to apply the team's analytical and business skills;
  • Leading the development of the scope, approach, governance and deliverables for strategic, cross functional or complex projects undertaken by the team;
  • Providing oversight of project deliverables, including the quality of insights created, the accuracy of analysis undertaken, clarity of messaging and ensure deadlines agreed with client business areas are met; and
  • Coaching and mentoring your team, to develop and build a strong consulting and advanced analytical tool set.


Let’s Get To Know You
  • You hold experience as an Engagement Manager or similar at a top tier Management Consulting (tier 1);
  • You hold a background in strategy development and business planning;
  • You hold demonstrated experience of working directly with C-level executives and building relationships with internal and external stakeholder;
  • You hold experience leading, developing and coaching a team of experienced management consultants.



What You’ll Get From Us

Let's be honest – you skipped to the best part, didn’t you?! And why wouldn’t you with these benefits:
  • Experience the Virgin Australia Culture which is unlike anything else you have experienced. Become part of an internationally recognised brand that feels like family.
  • The sky is the limit when it comes to career development, feel encouraged to diversify your skills and experience with access to internal vacancies.
  • See Australia and the world with access to heavily discounted flights for you, your family and friends on Virgin Australia and many of our interline partners. We are extremely proud of our Team Travel program and it won’t take long to realise why.
  • Take advantage of countless industry discounts – Lounge membership, hotels, travel insurance, car hire, tours, retail… the list goes on.
  • Improve your Mind, Body and Soul with access to discounted fitness programs and a free onsite physiotherapist. We also offer discounted Corporate Health Insurance through multiple partners to suit your individual lifestyle.

Ready to spread your wings? / Ready for your career to take off?

Boarding for this opportunity won’t last long – register your interest today by submitting an application via the link below.

Job description

Brilliant new membership & engagement role will suit someone with membership, events & marketing communications experience. High profile organisation.
MEMBERSHIP & EVENTS COORDINATOR
Melbourne (10 mins north of CBD)
Productive, high energy team

Membership activities will form 70% of this role, and events will take up roughly 30%, so candidates who only bring events experience will not be considered.

This role will suit an energetic, motivated communications specialist whose primary goal in life is to support existing members and be constantly striving to reach and attract new customers. In conjunction with growing and supporting our membership base, the position will also include regular event management.

Working in a productive, friendly team, you will enjoy maximising membership sales and using your marketing and outreach skills to constantly be attracting new members to the group.

You will be regularly liaising with member benefit providers and industry bodies and will work towards implementing strategies to maximise sales and growth targets.

With solid event management skills, part of your role will be to plan, coordinate and oversee a range of forums, workshops and member meetings, ensuring these activities offer value to your member base and create loyal, long lasting productive relationships.

You will be assisting members and the general public with information, and work hard to manage, support and attract a range of corporate sponsors and partners.

You will have a positive, approachable manner, and you will love a lot of stakeholder engagement. Armed with great communication and administration skills, you will flourish in a role that provides so many benefits, not only to the marketplace, but to the broader community from the perspective of professional development, training, and social engagement.

Early Career Researcher Opportunities (ongoing & non-ongoing)
Recruiting Australia’s Brightest Science and Technology Early Career Researchers

Multiple permanent and temporary research opportunities
Access to professional development programs & mentoring
Various locations across Australia

The Defence Science and Technology (DST) Group’s Early Career Researcher Opportunities is a portal for scientists, engineers, and industry professionals to register their interest to commence a career in research at one of the world’s leading defence science and technology organisations.

Qualifications

DST has over 100 opportunities available across a broad range of research areas and is seeking applications from candidates with qualifications/ and or experience in the following academic discipline

Aerospace/ Aeronautical Engineering, and Naval Architecture
Computer Sciences, IT, Software Engineering, Telecommunications
Electronic/ Electrical Engineering
Psychology and Social Sciences
Materials Science
Mechanical and Mechatronic Engineering (including robotics)
Chemical, Radiological, Biological and Food Sciences
Mathematics and Physics

The DST Difference

Experience a stimulating and dynamic culture that fosters scientific excellence through innovation, creativity and professional development programs.

Work alongside and be mentored by some of the world's brightest scientists to deliver innovative solutions in support of Australia's Defence and national security.

Share in the rewards – challenging projects, a supportive team environment, and flexible, lifestyle-friendly work conditions.
